games.name: Hearts
games.KindOfDeck: A normal 52 card deck that has the 4 suits and no jokers
games.description: This image shows the set up, and a trick with 4 people, for Hearts. The person on the West side took it because they played the Ace of Clubs.

basic: In the same suit: Ace is highest; ace > king > queen > jack > 10 > 9 > 8 > 7 > 6 > 5 > 4 > 3 > 2 > non-suit-followers
The suits are: /b/style color: red /styleHearts/b, Spades, Clubs, and /b/style color: red /styleDiamonds/b
You must follow suit, and play it if you have it.
test ///breally/b
/b/uIf you cannot follow suit/u/b: if you have the /b/uQueen of Spades/u/b in your hand: you must drop it; otherwise you can play any card/p/p
To take the /utrick/u and the /ulead/u (if you did not already have it), you must play a card in suit, in your hand, that ranks above all of the other cards played in suit.
After taking a /utrick/u and the lead, you get to pick the next card and suit, from your hand, to lead with.
A /utrick/u is when all players have each played one card face up in the middle of the table for all to see.

/b/uThe First Trick NOTE/u/b: When 52 is not evenly divisible by the number of players (52 divided by 3 = 17 remainder 1), the extra card(s) are face down and will be awarded to the person who took the first trick. Only they can see these.
Only the last played trick is allowed to be shown to all players if one requests it minus any extra cards or other tricks./p/p

If a /b/uRule Violation/u/b is declared and proved, the player that violated it gets 25 points added to thier score and the caller gets 1 point added to the caller's score. The rest get zero for that hand.
/b/uPremature Termination/u/b: is achieved when no more hearts are out there and the /b/uQueen of Spades/u/b has already been played and it is not possible for one to make the sun.
The other way to achieve /b/uPremature Termination/u/b is when one player has the lead and cannot get rid of it!
Calling /b/uPremature Termination/u/b: If that person declares the rest are theirs (to call it) and lied, they get all but one of the rest out there./p/p
SCORING: The /b/uQueen of Spades/u/b is worth 13 points; each heart is worth 1 point; all other cards are worth zero.
/b/uShooting the Moon/u/b: is achieved by the player that gets all 13 hearts and the /b/uQueen of Spades/u/b.
/b/uShooting the Sun/u/b: is achieved by the player that gets the entire deck (all 52 cards).
If someone /b/ushoots the moon/u/b, he or she adds zero (0) points to their score, and the shooter's opponents all add 26 points to their score each.
If someone /b/ushoots the sun/u/b, he or she adds (0) points to their score, and the shooter's opponents all add 52 points to their score each.
/b/uLowest Score Wins/u/b: Loser is first above 100 points.

You all pick the order and the passing strategies used (Person A always leads right, Person B always leads left, Person C always leads Hold, or have the lead rotate when you have more people than passing strategies). Suggested for 3 people: Right, Left, Hold; Suggested for 4 people: Right, Left, Accross or One-To-Each, Hold
vegasstyle: Person who has the /u2 of Clubs/u goes first, or next lowest when all players don't have it
No hearts can be lead until a heart or the /b/uQueen of Spades/u/b has been dropped (aside from the first trick); unless that is all you have left.

strategies: The probability for each hand of the only unknown card on first trick being a heart or the /b/uQueen of Spades/u/b is: 14/52 or 7/26 roughly 26%. If the shooter did not take the first trick, then roughly 26% of the time they lose if and only if it comes down to the first trick. I don't know about you, I'd take the 74% chance of the time winning.

/b/uTO SHOOT THE MOON OR THE SUN/u/b: You could have the hand for it (for the SUN it looks like having all of one suit and all aces and a king (self sun shoot), that is one such) (for the moon it looks like having at least Ace, King, Queen, Jack of Hearts and requiring them to be evenly split and you getting the lead, that is one such), or
/b/uTO SHOOT THE MOON OR THE SUN/u/b: play with people who let you shoot by intentionally playing just under each time, or

/b/uTO SHOOT THE MOON/u/b: shoot via /b/uPremature Termination/u/b (meaning: THE REST ARE YOURS (if no hearts and the /b/uQueen of Spades/u/b have not been dropped on anyone other than the shooter and either A or B for it to make it. A: the shooter took the first trick or B: the first trick was not a heart and not the /b/uQueen of Spades/u/b (roughly 74% chance each hand), it works) you played your lower cards while they played their higher cards making your cards high at the end)/br(/b/udown side to this/u/b: is forfiet /b/uthe Sun/u/b unless you take all of the tricks, and you will get stuck with a whole lot of points if you don't make it). /p/p
To try to get zero by: /b/ushooting the Moon or the Sun/u/b. or

To try to get zero by: playing just under the leader when the leader plays high. This ensures that you are dropping your high cards. So you are less likely to get stuck with the lead at the end./br/b/uThe downside of doing this/u/b: you are playing right into a shooter's hand or (you are letting a shooter /b/ushoot the moon or the sun/u/b).
To try to get zero by: short suiting yourself when you pass, so you can drop the /b/uQueen of Spades/u/b or your hearts and make sure that you cannot get stuck with the lead.
To try to get as few points as possible if zero is not possible by: When there is a shooter, the shooter must be stopped first. Sacrifice to stop a shooter, then manage to get rid of the lead.
